sections.heading: licenses to restaurants and clubs; conditions
sections.text: No person shall receive a retail license to sell alcoholic liquor upon any premises used as a restaurant or as a club unless such premises or plan of operation strictly complies with sections 53-103.09 and 53-103.30.SourceLaws 1935, c. 116, § 93, p. 425;

53-139.Retail licenses to restaurants and clubs; conditions.

No person shall receive a retail license to sell alcoholic liquor upon any premises used as a restaurant or as a club unless such premises or plan of operation strictly complies with sections 53-103.09 and 53-103.30.

SourceLaws 1935, c. 116, § 93, p. 425;C.S.Supp.,1941, § 53-393;R.S.1943, § 53-139;Laws 1989, LB 441, § 6;Laws 1994, LB 859, § 6;Laws 2010, LB861, § 71.
